entry.title: Informatics Ignite Talks 2012
entry.content:
On the 11th of December 2012 our team prepared a series of Ignite Talks to show our colleagues at UNEP-WCMC the work that we are doing and how we go about doing it.

The session started with a talk by our Head of Programme, Craig Mills. He talked about our team and work in 2012.

Next up was Agnieszka Figiel one of our Ruby on Rails Developers. Agnieszka explained how we go about delivering excelence.

I followed Agnieszka and talked about one of the big projects that we started in 2012, the Integrated Species Information Platform. A project that is focused in the redevelopment of the species databases maitained at UNEP-WCMC, and the creation of new bespoke public facing interfaces to explore that data.

James Cox talked about the A.P.E.S. Dashboard. This web application was developed in BackboneJS in early 2012 and is a way for Governments to decide where to invest their money to protect great apes.

DÃ©cio Ferreira talked about the Voluntary REDD+ Database. A tool to provide information to the global community on REDD+ financing, actions and results, providing the ability to search, summarise and visualize data. (Unfortunately his talk is not yet available online).

The last talk of this Ignite Session was done by Tim Wilkinson. Tim talked about the Abu Dhabi Blue Carbon project, our first iPad App. This application allows scientist to measure the carbon sequestered by coastal habitats like mangroves, seagrass, and others. Data can be collected off-line and then syncronised back into a web server.

After Tim's talk Craig Mills has closed the session with a quick glimpse into the year of 2013.
